result.execSummary:
The defendant Tarrance T Dalton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Enroll in a GED or HSED program within 60 days.
Maintain fulltime employment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No association with known drug drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, and no drug paraphernalia.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tarrance T Dalton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court gives credit for 1 day served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, and no drug paraphernalia.  
- Enroll in a GED or HSED program within 60 days.
- Maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 20 hours of community service at a non profit organization.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Defendant Tarrance T Dalton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Court is in trial.  Case scheduled for sentencing.  No spins available due to the lateness of the hour.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 2/10/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tarrance T Dalton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case transferred from Br. 03 forthwith for pleah.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tarrance T Dalton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 9/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tarrance T Dalton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel requests more time to go over discovery with client.  Any motions to be filed by the next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/22/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tarrance T Dalton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any illegal drugs.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tarrance T Dalton in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
